pr_title: Add host, path and query columns to the history table

timeline.message:
Add host, path and query columns to the history table

Signed-off-by: Diogo Silva <diogo.m.r.silva@tecnico.ulisboa.pt>

timeline.bodyText:
Since these are basically all the same why not extract a private method and pass the column constant?
Printing the stack trace should be replaced with a logger.
timeline.author: kingthorin

replies.bodyText: Also is the intermediate storage necessary? (var vs var1)
replies.author: kingthorin

replies.bodyText: That's because they are final instance variables. Although IMO the components should be shown encoded, showing them decoded leads to data loss and misleading values (crude example, the path /%2F will be shown as // which is a completely different path).
replies.author: thc202

replies.bodyText: @thc202 I also think that they should be shown encoded, I didn't notice that was happening. @kingthorin the functions I will use now don't throw exception and the code will become more clean.
replies.author: DiogoMRSilva

replies.bodyText:
The host should also be shown encoded (for same reason), e.g.:
new String(historyReference.getURI().getRawHost())
replies.author: thc202

timeline.bodyText: I'd expect these to be closer/next to the URL column by default (same in the enum).
timeline.author: thc202
